Based on the web search results, here's a comparison of the upload features for these three AI music generators:

## Upload Features Comparison

**Mubert:**
Users can upload an image that illustrates the concept or mood of their song if they don't want to use a text prompt. Additionally, Mubert Studio allows users to upload loops and samples to be used by the AI in future generations, making it particularly useful for musicians and producers who want to contribute their own content.

**Soundraw:**
The search results don't indicate that Soundraw has a specific upload feature for images or audio samples. Users simply instruct the AI music generator on the kind of music they want by choosing their preferred genre, mood, theme, tempo, and track length, and Soundraw will generate dozens of tracks that match their description.

**Amper Music:**
The search results don't mention specific upload features for Amper Music. Amper builds tracks from scratch with no pre-made loops in its library and no licensed material gets recycled, meaning content creators get unique compositions every time.

In summary, **Mubert stands out for its upload capabilities**, offering both image uploads for inspiration and the ability to upload loops and samples through Mubert Studio. Soundraw and Amper Music don't appear to offer these same upload features based on the available information.

Based on the search results, here's an overview of AI music generation tools and their upload/input capabilities:

## Text and Lyrics Input

Users can input text or upload lyrics, select a music style, and generate music with the click of a button.(no content)You can input a text description of the song you want, or you can input complete lyrics, and the tool will create a song that perfectly fits your lyrics.

## Audio File Upload

Several tools support uploading existing audio files for various purposes:

- Some systems can analyze and continue existing tracks in matching style or build upon uploaded audio.
- Platforms like AIVA combine accessibility for beginners with tools sophisticated enough for professionals, including reference track uploads, a MIDI editor, and multi-format exports, where users can upload their own MIDI or audio files to influence the generation algorithm.
- Upload your music files and use the AI Music Generator's Split Music feature to easily extract vocals, drums, and other elements from your tracks.
- Upload any audio clip and use it as a base for extension or cover versions. The generated song will reference the melody and timbre of your uploaded audio to create something new.

## Voice and Image Input

Voice cloning technology makes personalized covers simpler by uploading a small voice sample to instantly create your exclusive vocal model.(no content)Some tools allow users to start a song from their thoughts, written lyrics, or even an uploaded image.

## MIDI Editing

Users can create their own style models by uploading an audio or MIDI influence.

Based on the search results, here are some of the best Suno AI alternatives for AI music generation in 2026:

## Top Alternatives

**Udio** - One of the closest Suno alternatives for full songs with vocals, where users can type a short description and it creates music with singing, lyrics, and instruments.(no content)Udio is the best choice for producers wanting more control, remixing capabilities, and stem downloads.

**AIVA** - AIVA is the top pick for instrumental, cinematic, and orchestral compositions with full copyright ownership on Pro plans.

**Beatoven AI** - Beatoven AI is all about mood-based music, where users tell it what kind of feeling they want—happy, calm, intense, or relaxing—and it generates a track that matches.

**Soundful** - Soundful is a perfect alternative if users want to make music fast without knowing anything about composing. Users just pick a style like chill or upbeat, select the mood, and it generates a song in minutes, with music that is royalty-free.

**Boomy** - Boomy is one of the fastest ways to make a full song, where users can select a style like pop, rock, or electronic, and the AI creates rhythm, instruments, and melody automatically, with the option to add their own vocals.

## Market Context

The two dominant players, Suno and Udio, now compete with established tools like AIVA and newcomers like Mureka and ElevenLabs Eleven Music. Each platform excels in different areas depending on your specific needs—whether you're looking for vocal quality, orchestral music, speed, or customization.

Links: [{"title":"I tested 7 Suno alternatives: Here’s the best AI music generator in 2025","url":"https://www.eesel.ai/blog/suno-alternatives"},{"title":"7 AI Music Generation Tools Tested -Suno Alternative? | by Joyce Birkins | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@joycebirkins/7-ai-music-generation-tools-tested-suno-alternative-19c1892512d3"},{"title":"Best Suno AI Alternatives Free in 2026 for AI Music Creation","url":"https://www.topmediai.com/ai-music/suno-ai-alternatives/"},{"title":"5 Best Suno AI Alternatives in 2025 | Musicfy AI Blog","url":"https://musicfy.lol/blog/suno-ai-alternative"},{"title":"Top 3 Suno AI Alternatives in 2025 for Digital Content Creators","url":"https://www.beatoven.ai/blog/suno-ai-alternatives/"},{"title":"The 18 Best Suno AI Alternatives - Free & Paid","url":"https://maestra.ai/blogs/suno-ai-alternatives"},{"title":"5 Suno AI Alternatives (Free & Paid) – Tested and Reviewed","url":"https://www.musicful.ai/vs/suno-ai-alternative/"},{"title":"10 Best Suno Alternatives for Exquisite AI Music Expression | Tad AI","url":"https://tad.ai/hub/best-suno-alternatives"},{"title":"Suno AI Alternative","url":"https://ilovesong.ai/sunoaialternative"},{"title":"5 best Suno AI alternatives tested in 2025 | top picks & reviews","url":"https://techpoint.africa/guide/best-suno-ai-alternatives/"}]

Based on the search results, here's a comprehensive comparison of the best alternatives to Suno AI music generator:

## Top Alternatives

**Udio**
Udio produces the best-quality music and allows for free downloads of generated tracks.(no content)Unlike others that immediately ask for payment, Udio gives users 10 daily credits for free music generation, with additional monthly credits available.(no content)Udio offers vocal music generation, which is rare among AI music tools, and you can even write your own lyrics for the track.(no content)Udio's AI-generated music is most comparable to Suno in terms of quality, though it lacks Suno's wider recognition.

**Beatoven.ai**
Beatoven.ai is a renowned AI music generator with over 1 million users and $2 million in funding that specializes in mood-specific music for videos, podcasts, and games, featuring a DAW-like tool that supports 16 moods and allows users to adjust instrumentation, volume, length, and tempo.(no content)Beatoven.ai offers text-to-music AI prompting options to generate music, and the more detailed the prompt you provide, the more precise music it generates based on the prompt.

**AIVA**
AIVA is an AI music assistant that allows you to generate music in more than 250 different styles.(no content)AIVA offers two creation modes—v1.0 and v2.0—allowing everything from chord progressions to key signatures and even MIDI/audio uploads, and isn't about fast song generation from simple prompts but is designed for composers who want more granular control over structure, harmony, and style.

**Boomy**
Boomy is an artist-focused AI song generator that allows monetization and streaming on music apps like Spotify, where you create music using the AI generator and share it across associated platforms to earn royalty.

**Other Alternatives**
Riffusion is one of the most accessible and visually engaging AI music generators on the market, known for its lightning-fast output and intuitive prompt system, ideal for creators who want quick demos or social media-ready music in seconds.

Each tool has different strengths—Udio for quality vocals, Beatoven.ai for customization, AIVA for granular control, and Boomy for monetization opportunities.

content.text: Now let me get more specific information on upload capabilities and unique features by accessing a couple of detailed comparison articles.

input.prompt: What are the specific upload capabilities, input features, and unique features of each Suno alternative?
What are the key differences and unique features between Suno and its alternatives, especially regarding input methods and upload capabilities?

content.content:
# Key Differences Between Suno AI and Its Alternatives

Based on the article, here are the primary distinctions:

## Input Methods

**Suno AI** generates full songs with vocals and lyrics from text prompts, creating complete tracks with singing and instruments automatically.

Most alternatives use similar text-based prompting but with different emphases:

- **Udio** focuses on "full songs with vocals" through descriptive text, positioning itself as the closest competitor to Suno
- **Soundful, Beatoven, and Ecrett** use mood/style selection rather than freeform prompts
- **Melobytes** takes a creative approach, converting "text, images, or even drawings into music"

## Upload Capabilities

The article emphasizes that alternatives differ significantly in what users can upload:

- **Boomy AI** allows users to "add their own vocals" to generated tracks
- **Voicemod AI Music** focuses on voice transformation rather than music generation
- **Music.AI** specializes in editing existing audio rather than generation

Most platforms don't emphasize upload features; instead, they prioritize **royalty-free downloads** for commercial use across video, podcast, and game projects.

## Unique Positioning

Rather than direct feature parity, alternatives differentiate through specialization: emotional/cinematic music (Aiva), endless generation (Mubert), scene-based creation (Ecrett), or educational approaches (Splash Pro).

# Key Differences Between Suno AI and Its Alternatives

Based on the article, here are the primary distinctions:

## Input Methods

**Suno AI** generates full songs with vocals and lyrics from text prompts, creating complete tracks with singing and instruments automatically.

Most alternatives use similar text-based prompting but with different emphases:

- **Udio** focuses on "full songs with vocals" through descriptive text, positioning itself as the closest competitor to Suno
- **Soundful, Beatoven, and Ecrett** use mood/style selection rather than freeform prompts
- **Melobytes** takes a creative approach, converting "text, images, or even drawings into music"

## Upload Capabilities

The article emphasizes that alternatives differ significantly in what users can upload:

- **Boomy AI** allows users to "add their own vocals" to generated tracks
- **Voicemod AI Music** focuses on voice transformation rather than music generation
- **Music.AI** specializes in editing existing audio rather than generation

Most platforms don't emphasize upload features; instead, they prioritize **royalty-free downloads** for commercial use across video, podcast, and game projects.

## Unique Positioning

Rather than direct feature parity, alternatives differentiate through specialization: emotional/cinematic music (Aiva), endless generation (Mubert), scene-based creation (Ecrett), or educational approaches (Splash Pro).

content.content:
# Suno Alternatives: Upload Capabilities and Unique Features

Based on the article's comparison, here are the key input features and capabilities:

## Upload & Input Methods

**Udio**: Text prompts describing desired vocals and genres. The interface emphasizes simplicity with "super simple and clean" design for genre-based generation.

**Beatoven.ai**: Selection-based inputs with "16 different moods and 9 genres" to choose from, plus a distinctive "recompose" feature allowing users to "edit instruments and melodies in specific parts of the track."

**Soundraw**: Granular customization where you can "adjust the intensity of different sections" and "add or remove individual instruments with a click," offering the deepest track-level control.

**Mubert**: Activity-based streaming (focusing, working out, relaxing) rather than single-track generation, with API access for developers integrating music into applications.

**AIVA**: Style selection from "over 250 different style models" with MIDI file downloads enabling further editing in professional DAWs.

**Boomy**: Speed-focused with minimal inputs—users can "generate a song in seconds with just a few clicks," sacrificing customization for rapid creation.

**Musicfy**: Text-to-music prompts combined with "voice cloning features" for creating custom AI vocal models or covers.

Each tool prioritizes different creative workflows: vocal quality (Udio), mood matching (Beatoven.ai), instrument control (Soundraw), or speed (Boomy).

content.text:
Based on my research, here's a comprehensive comparison of Suno alternatives focused on upload capabilities and unique features:

## Suno Alternatives Comparison Table

| **Tool** | **Primary Input Method** | **Upload Capabilities** | **Key Unique Features** | **Best For** |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| **Udio** | Text prompts | No direct upload | Highest vocal quality, lyrics creation, stem downloads, remixing | Full songs with professional vocals |
| **AIVA** | Text + Style selection | MIDI/Audio upload for influence | 250+ styles, orchestral focus, copyright ownership (Pro), DAW-like editor | Cinematic & orchestral music |
| **Beatoven.ai** | Mood + Genre selection | No direct upload | 16 moods, 9 genres, instrument-level editing, "recompose" feature | Mood-specific video/podcast music |
| **Soundraw** | Genre/Mood/Tempo selection | No direct upload | Intense instrument-level customization, section-specific adjustments | Maximum track control |
| **Mubert** | Activity-based (focus/workout) | Image upload + Loop/Sample upload | API access for developers, streaming focus, studio version | Background music for activities |
| **Boomy** | Minimal style selection | User vocals can be added | Spotify monetization, fastest generation, artist-focused | Quick creation & revenue sharing |
| **Riffusion** | Text prompts | No direct upload | Visually engaging interface, lightning-fast output | Social media & demo content |
| **Musicfy** | Text + Lyrics input | Voice sample upload for cloning | Voice cloning technology, cover creation | Custom vocal models & covers |

## Key Findings on Upload Capabilities

**Strong Upload Support:**
- **AIVA**: Upload MIDI or audio files to influence generation algorithm
- **Mubert**: Image uploads for mood inspiration + loop/sample uploads in Studio version
- **Musicfy**: Voice sample uploads for AI vocal model creation

**Limited Upload Options:**
- **Udio, Beatoven.ai, Soundraw, Boomy, Riffusion**: Primarily text/selection-based; no audio/MIDI upload features
- **Music.AI**: Specializes in editing existing audio (different use case)

## What Makes Each Unique vs Suno

| Tool | Suno's Strength | This Tool's Difference |
|---|---|---|
| **Udio** | Full songs | Better vocal quality & stem downloads for remixing |
| **AIVA** | Speed & simplicity | Professional orchestral quality & copyright ownership |
| **Beatoven.ai** | Vocal-focused | Mood-specific customization & instrument editing |
| **Soundraw** | Text-to-music | Granular per-instrument control |
| **Mubert** | Single track generation | Continuous streaming API & developer tools |
| **Musicfy** | Original generation | Voice cloning for personalized covers |

## Notable Gaps

Most alternatives lack robust upload capabilities—**only AIVA, Mubert, and Musicfy offer meaningful file upload features**. If direct audio/MIDI input is important for your workflow, these three are your best options.

Sources:
- [Eesel AI - Suno Alternatives](https://www.eesel.ai/blog/suno-alternatives)
- [Nimble App Genie - Suno Alternatives](https://www.nimbleappgenie.com/blogs/suno-ai-alternatives/)
- [DigitalOcean - AI Music Generators](https://www.digitalocean.com/resources/articles/ai-music-generators)
- [Beatoven.ai Blog - Suno Alternatives](https://www.beatoven.ai/blog/suno-ai-alternatives/)
- [Maestra - 18 Suno Alternatives](https://maestra.ai/blogs/suno-ai-alternatives)
- [Superprompt - Music Generators Comparison](https://superprompt.com/blog/best-ai-music-generators)
